materials: AUNT LYDIA’S Baker’s Cotton: 1 ball each 12 Black A and 900 Red B
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Chrysanthemum measures 2¼” (6 cm), Large 6-Petal Flower measures 2¾” (7 cm), Small 6-Petal Flower measures 2¼” (6 cm), 8-Petal Flower measures 3¼” (8 cm)
gauge: Rounds 1-2 of Large 6-Petal Flower = 1¼” (3 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Round 1: Ch 1, [hdc in ring, ch 2] 6 times; join with slip st in first hdc—6 ch-2 loops.
Round 2: Slip st in first ch-2 loop, ch 1, *(hdc, work popcorn, hdc) in ch-2 loop, ch 2; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of first popcorn and fasten off—6 popcorns.
Round 3: Join A in top of any popcorn, (ch 1, sc) in same st, * in next ch-2 loop work (2 dc, ch 2, tr, dtr, tr, ch 2, 2 dc), sc in top of popcorn; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—12 tr, 6 dtr.
Round 4: *Sc in each of next 4 sts, hdc in tr, (hdc, dc, hdc) in dtr, hdc in next tr, sc in each of next 4 sts, slip st in sc; repeat from * around, joining round with last slip st; fasten off.
Small 6-Petal Flowers (make 3)
Rounds 1-2: With B, repeat Rounds 1-2 of Large 6-Petal Flower.
Round 3: With A, join in top of any popcorn, (ch 2, dc, tr, ch 2, slip st in tr, dc, ch 2, slip st) in top of popcorn, in next ch-2 loop work (sc, fptr around hdc of Round 1 directly below, sc), slip st in next popcorn; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first ch and fasten off—6 fptr, 12 dc, 6 tr.
8-Petal Flowers (make 1 in A/B, 2 in B/A)
With A or B ch 7, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Work beg cl, ch 2, [cl, ch 2] 7 times in ring; join with slip st in first cl—8 cl.
Round 2: Slip st in next ch-2 loop, ch 1, (sc in ch loop, ch 4) around; join with slip st in first sc; fasten off—8 ch-4 loops.
Round 3: With B or A, join in any ch-4 loop, ch 1, (sc in ch-4 loop, ch 4) around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 4 (petal round): (Slip st in next ch-4 loop, ch 10, hdc in 3rd ch from hook, dc in each of next 3 ch, tr in each of next 4 ch, slip st in same ch loop) around; join with slip st in first ch and fasten off—8 petals.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block. With dots of glue on underside of appliques, glue to object in preferred grouping, or follow photo for placement.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Changes®: 2 balls 9403 Granite
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 10” x 38” (25 cm x 96.5 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not critical to this project.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
Freeform crocheters usually use many different yarns to create their interesting multi-textured projects. But with this yarn the texture changes as you work, so you only need one yarn to create this scarf!
Only, sc in first 4 sts, hdc in next 6 sts, 2 dc in each of next 13 sts, hdc next st, sc in next st, slip st in last st—39 sts. Fasten off.
Flower (make 2)
Ch 4, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, work 10 sc in ring, join with slip st in first sc—10 sc.
Round 2: [Ch 2, work 3 tr in next st, ch 2, slip st in next st (petal made)] 5 times, join with slip st in first ch of beginning ch-2—5 petals. Fasten off.
Fan (make 3)
Ch 7, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Row 1: Ch 1, work 6 sc in ring, do not join, turn—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in first sc, 2 dc in each sc across, turn—12 dc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each dc across, turn—12 sc.
Row 4: Ch 5 (counts as first dc and ch 2), skip first sc, dc in next sc, *ch 2, skip next sc, dc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—6 ch-2 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 1, (sc, hdc, ch 3, slip st in top of last hdc made, hdc, sc) in each ch-space—6 repeats. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Using photograph as a guide, sew paisleys, flowers, and fans to bottom mesh of scarf. Fold at neck to form collar and sew button to inner edge of Row 28. Blocking is not recommended for this garment.
SCARF
Beginning at bottom, ch 23.
Row 1: Sc in 8th ch from hook, [ch 5, skip next 4 ch, sc in next ch] 3 times, turn—4 loops.
Rows 2-12: Ch 7, sc in first loop, ch 5, *sc in next loop, ch 5; repeat from * across to last loop, sc in the 3rd ch of beginning ch-7, turn.
Row 13: Ch 7, sc in first loop, ch 5, *sc in next loop, ch 5; repeat from * across to last loop, sc in last loop, ch 5, tr in the 3rd ch of the beginning ch-7 (increase made), turn—5 loops.
Rows 14-16: Repeat Row 2.
Row 17: Repeat Row 13—6 loops.
Rows 18-21: Repeat Row 2.
Row 22: Repeat Row 13—7 loops.
Rows 23-26: Repeat Row 2.
Row 27: Ch 1, 4 sc in first loop, 5 sc in each of next 5 loops 5 times, 4 sc in last loop, turn—33 sc.
Rows 28-107: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc across, turn.
Buttonhole Row: Ch 1, sc in first 16 sc, ch 6, skip next 6 sc, sc in remaining 11 sc, turn—27 sc and ch-6 loop.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in first 11 sc, sc in each ch of the loop, sc on remaining 16 sc—33 sc. Fasten off.
Paisley (make 2)
Ch 13.
Round 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 2 ch, hdc in next 4 ch, dc in next 4 ch, 5 dc in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, dc in next 4 ch, hdc in next 4 ch, sc in next 3 ch, do not join and do not turn—27 sts.
Row 2 (right side): Working in back loops only, sc in first 10 sts, 2 sc each of next 8 sts, leave remaining sts unworked—26 sts. Fasten off.
Row 3 (right side): Join yarn with slip st to back loop of first sc, ch 1, working back loops.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 450 Aqua A, 275 Coral B, 423 Maize C, 332 Hot Pink D, 484 Myrtle Green E, 397 Wasabi F, and 856 Peacock G
Yarn needle, stitch marker, sewing needle and matching thread
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Motifs 1 and 2 measure 1¾” (4.5 cm) diameter. Motif 3 measures 2¾” wide x 2¼” long (7 x 5.5 cm). Motif 4 measures 1” wide x 1½” long (2.5 x 4 cm). Motif 5 measures ¾” (2 cm) from center to outer edge of each petal. Motif 6 measures 2½” x 1½” long (6.5 x 4 cm), excluding stem which measures 9” (23 cm) long. Motifs 7 and 8 measure 1” wide x 2” long (2.5 x 5 cm). Motifs 9 and 10 measure ½” wide x 1 1/8” long (1.5 x 3 cm). Motif 11 measures 1¾” wide x 2” long (4.5 x 5 cm). Motif 12 measures 1½” wide x 3½” long (4 x 9 cm). Motif 13 measures 1” wide x 3” long (2.5 x 7.5 cm), unopened. Motif 14 measures 1½” wide x 2¾” long (4 x 7 cm), unopened. Motif 15 measures ¼” wide x 1¼” long (.5 x 3 cm).
gauge: Rounds 1–3 of 7-Petal Flower = 1¾” (4.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FLORAL DECORATION 
Motif 1: 7-Petal Flower (make 7) 
With A, ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 4 (counts as first dc, ch 1), dc in ring, [ch 1, dc in ring] 5 times, ch 1; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beg ch—7 dc and 7 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off.
Round 2: Join B with slip st in any ch-1 space, ch 3 (counts as first dc), 2 dc in same space, (ch 1, 3 dc) in each ch-1 space, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beg ch—21 dc and 7 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off. 
Round 3: Join C with sc in any ch-1 space, (hdc, dc) in next dc, 2 tr in next dc, (dc, hdc) in next dc, [sc in next ch-1 space, (hdc, dc) in next dc, 2 tr in next dc, (dc, hdc) in next d] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—7 sc, 14 hdc, 14 dc, and 14 tr. Fasten off.
Motif 2: 5-Petal Flower (make 3) 
With C, ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Beg 3-dc Cl in ring, [ch 3, 3-dc Cl in ring] 4 times, ch 3; join with slip st in beg Cl—5 Cls and 5 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off. 
Round 2: Join D with slip st in any ch-3 space, 5 sc in same space, (ch 1, 5 sc) in each ch-3 space, ch 1; join with slip st in first sc—25 sc and 5 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off.
Round 3: Join B with slip st in first sc, ch 3, 2 tr in next 3 sc, ch 3, slip st in next sc (petal made), [ch 1, slip st in next sc, ch 3, 2 tr in next 3 sc, ch 3, slip st in next sc (petal made)] 4 times, ch 1; join with slip st in first sc—5 petals. Fasten off.
Motif 3: Large 3-Color Flower (make 3) 
With A, ch 12.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 6th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first ch-5 space) and in next ch, tr in next 3 ch, dc in next ch, (dc, ch 5, slip st) in last dc—4 dc, 3 tr, and 2 ch-5 spaces. Do not turn.
Round 2: Working in opposite side of foundation ch, ch 1, sc in first ch (same ch as last slip st made), 2 sc in next ch, sc in next 3 ch, 2 sc in next ch, sc in next ch, 7 sc in first ch-5 space, sc in first dc, 2 sc in next dc, sc in next 3 tr, 2 sc in next dc, sc in next dc, 7 sc in last ch-5 space; change to C; join with slip st in first sc—32 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [ch 4, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc] 3 times, ch 5, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc, [ch 7, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc] twice, ch 5, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc, ch 4, skip last 3 sc; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc, 4 ch-4 spaces, 2 ch-5 spaces, and 2 ch-7 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 1, (sc, hdc, 4 dc, hdc, sc) in first 3 ch-4 spaces, (sc, hdc, 5 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-5 space, (sc, hdc, 7 dc, hdc, sc) in each ch-7 space, (sc, hdc, 3 dc, place marker on last dc made, 2 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-5 space, (sc, hdc, 4 dc, hdc, sc) in last ch-4 space; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc, 16 hdc, and 40 dc. Fasten off. 
Row 5 (wrong side): With wrong side facing, join D with sc in marked st, [ch 10, skip next 9 sts, sc in next dc] 3 times, turn—4 sc and 3 ch-10 spaces.
Row 6 (right side): Ch 1, (sc, hdc, 4 dc, 4 tr, 4 dc, hdc, sc) in each ch-10 space; join with slip st in last sc. Fasten off. 
Motif 4: Pink Flower Petal (make 9) 
With D, ch 14.
Row 1 (right side): Tr in 7th ch from hook and in next 2 ch (beginning ch count as ch-6 space), dc in next 3 ch, sc in next ch, slip st in last ch—8 sts and 1 ch-6 space. 
Round 2: With right side facing and working in opposite side of foundation ch, ch 1, slip st in first ch, sc in next 7 ch, (picot, [2 dc, picot] 4 times) in ch-6 space, sc in next 8 sts; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
Motif 5: 3-Petal Flower (make 3 each with A & D and 1 with B)
Ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in ring, [ch 3, sc in ring] twice, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc—3 sc and 3 ch-3 spaces.
Round 2: (Slip st, ch 4, 3-tr Cl, picot, ch 4, slip st, ch 1) in each ch-3 space; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off. 
Motif 6: Long-stemmed Flower (make 3) 
With E, ch 75. 
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across to last ch, ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 5 dc in last ch (stem made), turn—73 sc and 6 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3, 2 dc in next 4 dc, 2 dc in top of beginning ch—11 dc. Fasten off. 
Row 3 (right side): With right side facing, join A with slip st in first dc, [ch 6, slip st in next dc] 10 times—10 ch-6 spaces. Fasten off.
Row 4: With right side facing, join D with slip st in first ch-6 space, (slip st, ch 4, tr, picot, tr, ch 4, slip st) in each ch-6 space. Fasten off. 
Motif 7: Large Leaf (make 6) 
With F, ch 19, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in next 2 ch, tr in next 8 ch, dc in next 2 ch, hdc in next 2 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working in opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in next 2 ch, tr in next 8 ch, dc in next 2 ch, hdc in next 2 ch, sc in last ch; join with slip st in first ch. 
Fasten off. 
Motif 8: Large 2-Color Leaf (make 6) 
With F, ch 19, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in next 2 ch, tr in next 8 ch, dc in next 2 ch, hdc in next 2 ch, 2 sc in last ch; change to E, sc in same ch; working in opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in next 2 ch, tr in next 8 ch, dc in next 2 ch, hdc in next 2 ch, sc in last ch; join with slip st in first ch. Fasten off. 
Motif 9: Small 2-Color Leaf (make 4) 
With F, ch 12, slip st in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch count as ch-2 space), sc in next 2 ch, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in next 4 ch, hdc in next ch (hdc; change to E, hdc) in last ch; working in opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, dc in next 4 ch, hdc in next 2 ch, sc in next 2 ch, slip st in ch-2 space. 
Fasten off.
Motif 10: Small Leaf (make 12)  
With G, repeat Motif 9, do not change color.
Motif 11: 2 Leaves with Stem (make 4) 
With E, ch 20, *slip st in 3rd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, sc in next ch, slip st in next ch (leaf made)*; ch 8, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next 6 ch (top stem made); ch 8, repeat from * to *; slip st in last 12 ch (bottom stem made). 
Fasten off.
Motif 12: Picoted Leaf 
With E, ch 23.
Round 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 sc, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in next 3 ch, tr in next 5 ch, dtr in next 6 ch, tr in next ch, dc in next ch, 3 hdc in last ch; working in opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, dc in next 2 ch, tr in next ch, dtr in next 6 ch, tr in next 5 ch, dc in next 3 ch, hdc in next 2 ch, sc in next 3 ch; ch 6, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 4 ch (stem made); join with slip st in first sc. 
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first 8 sts, [picot, dc in next 3 sts] 11 times, sc in next 4 sts, slip st in each sc of stem. Fasten off.
Motif 13: 3-Point Leaf (make 3) 
With F, ch 9, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 7 ch (stem made), [ch 20, dc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch across; join with slip st in last sc of stem] twice. Fasten off.
Motif 14: 4-Point Leaf
With F, ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in last ch (stem made); *ch 23, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next 2 ch, dtr in next 3 ch, dc in next 2 ch, hdc in next ch, sc in last 12 ch, slip st in 2nd sc of stem (leaf made)*; [ch 15, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across] twice (2nd and 3rd leaves made); repeat from * to *. Fasten off.
Motif 15: Small Stem
With E, ch 11, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 9 ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block pieces to finished measurements, if desired.
Referring to photographs, sew all pieces in place on back of jacket and sleeves.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream The Original™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Yellow (00010) 1 ball or 18 yds/16 m
Contrast B Black (00002) 1 ball or 6 yds/5 m
Contrast A Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 5 yds/4 m
Contrast B Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball or 9 yds/8 m
Contrast C Robin’s Egg (01215) 1 ball or 14 yds/13 m
Contrast D Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball or 19 yds/17 m
Contrast E Yellow (00010) 1 ball or 6 yds/5 m
Contrast A Robin’s Egg (01215) 1 ball or 16 yds/14 m
Contrast B Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 20 yds/18 m
Contrast A Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball or 14 yds/13 m
Contrast B Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 12 yds/11 m
Size U.S. F/5 [3.75 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Smiley Face:  Approx 4" [10 cm] diameter. Granny Square:  Approx 4½" [11.5 cm] square. Checkered Square:  Approx 5" [12.5 cm] square. Mushroom: Approx 4½" [11.5 cm] tall x 4" [10 cm] wide.
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join rnds with sl st to first st.
SMILEY FACE 
(See diagram on page 4).
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. 
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 2. 12 hdc in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 24 hdc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 2. *2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 36 hdc.
4th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in next st. 2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. Rep from * around. 48 hdc. Break A. Join B.
5th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off.
Eyes (make 2)
With B, ch 4.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in next ch. Fasten off. 
Surface Slip Stitch Smile
With RS facing, join B with sl st to any stitch in the 4th rnd of Smiley Face. Working along top of 4th rnd, work surface slip stitch as follows: *Insert hook into next st and draw up a loop through loop on hook. Rep from * until you have worked across the tops of 24 stitches in 4th rnd. Fasten off. 
Sew Eyes to Smiley Face as shown in photo.
GRANNY SQUARE 
(See diagram on page 4).
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 3). (3 dc in ring. Ch 3) 3 times. 2 dc in ring. Join. Fasten off. 12 dc and 4 ch-3 sps. 
2nd rnd:  Join B in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from *twice. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off. 
3rd rnd: Join C in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off. 
4th rnd: Join D in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-2 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp across to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice. (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp across to first ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off. 
5th rnd: Join E to any ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 4 sc in same ch-3 sp. Work 1 sc in each sc and ch-1 sp, and 4 sc in each ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off. 
CHECKERED SQUARE 
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
With A, ch 22.
1st row: (RS). With A, 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. (With B, 1 hdc in each of next 4 ch. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 4 ch) twice. Turn. 20 hdc.
2nd row:  With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
3rd and 4th rows:  With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
5th and 6th rows: As 2nd row.
Rep 3rd to 6th rows until work from beg measures approx 5" [12.5 cm], ending after a 4th or 6th row. Fasten off.

With RS facing, join A with sl st to any corner. Work 3 sc in same sp as sl st. Work in sc evenly around, working 3 sc in each corner. Join. Fasten off. 
MUSHROOM
(See diagrams on page 4).
Mushroom Cap 
With A, ch 16.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 15 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. 13 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th to 7th rows: As 2nd row. 5 sc. 
8th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 3 sts.
9th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off. 
Join B.
1st rnd: With B, ch 1. Work evenly in sc around entire Cap, working 3 sc in each corner sp. Join. Fasten off. 
Mushroom Stem
With B, ch 6.
1st row:  1 sc in 2nd chain from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. 7 sc.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) twice. 5 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc3tog. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 3 sts.
7th row: As 2nd row.
8th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off. 
Join A.
1st rnd:  With A, ch 1. Work in sc evenly around entire Stem, working 3 sc in each corner. Join. Fasten off. 
Mushroom Spots
Small Spot (make 2)
With B, beg using magic loop method demonstrated here. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sl st in ring. Join. Fasten off. 
Large Spot (make 1)
With B, make magic loop. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sl st in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. Sl st in each sl st around. Join. Fasten off. 
Sew Spots to Mushroom Cap as shown in photo. Align Mushroom Cap and Stem and sew in place as shown in photo.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m) Any shade of choice.
Size U.S. G/5 (3.75 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 2" [5 cm] tall.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Use these crocheted alphabet letters to personalize or send a message on your creations. Each letter is approx 2" [5 cm] tall and can be sewn or applied with fabric glue.
A
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch for center bar. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch from original ch-8.  Turn. Ch 4. Sl st in tip of center bar. Ch 5. Turn. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in sl st. 1 sc in each of last 4 ch. Join with sl st in first st. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
B
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 5. Skip first 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc.  Ch 6. Skip next 2 sc. Sl st in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Skip first sl st. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. Sl st in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 5 ch. Join with sl st in edge of 1st row.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
C
Ch 13.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. 12 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into ‘C’ when sewing or gluing in position.
D
Ch 17.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. 3 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 7 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st in first st.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
E
Ch 8.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. (Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch of original ch-8) twice. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in side of last sc along ch-8.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
F
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch of original ch-8. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in last ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
G
Ch 15.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in same sp as original sl st. 1 sc in each of rem 13 ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into ‘G’ when sewing or gluing in position.
H
Left Side
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch for center bar. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch of original ch-8.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Right Side
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. 7 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew Sides tog along center bar.
I
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. 7 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
J
Ch 10.
1st row:  1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in side of last sc along original ch-10. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in same sc along side.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into "J" while sewing or gluing in position.
K
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Sl st in last sc along original ch-8. Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Sl st in same sc along side. 1 sc in rem ch of original ch-8.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
L
Ch 12.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Skip next ch. 1 sc in each of last 7 ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
M
Ch 21.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 9 ch. Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in rem 10 ch of original ch-21.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into ‘M’ while sewing or gluing in position.
N
Ch 25.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. Skip next ch. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. Skip next ch. 1 sc in each of rem 7 ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into ‘N’ while sewing or gluing in position.
O
Ch 17. Join with slip st in first ch to make a ring.
1st rnd: 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st in first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
P
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 5. Skip first 3 sc. Sl st in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
3rd row:  1 sc in each ch of ch-5. Sl st in last ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Q
Ch 17. Join with slip st in first ch to make a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st in first ch. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
R
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 5. Skip first 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc for center sc. Ch 5. Turn. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Sl st in center sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch of first ch-5 sp. Join with sl st in edge of 1st row.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
S
Ch 17.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. 16 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into ‘S’ while sewing or gluing in position.
T
Ch 8.
1st row:  1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in side of last sc along original ch-8. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in same sc along side.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
U
Ch 17.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. 16 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into ‘U’ while sewing or gluing in position.
V
Ch 18.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. 17 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into ‘V’ while sewing or gluing in position.
W
Work as given for M, reversing direction while sewing in place.
X
Make 2 pieces alike.
Ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. 7 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Shape pieces into ‘X’ by crossing in center while sewing or gluing in position.
Y
1st row: (Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch) twice. Sl st in first ch. Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Join with sl st in original sl st.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Z
Ch 16.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Skip next ch. 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. Skip next ch. 1 sc in each of rem 4 ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Shape into ‘Z’ while sewing or gluing in position.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ “Cosmic™”: 1 ball color desired.
Yarn hook; optional purchased pin back; sewing needle and thread.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Flowers measure 4” across.
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions:
Using only the thin sections of the yarn, make a slip knot, ch 1 in same thin section, * let the thick section fold on itself, forming a loop, ch 2 with the next thin section; repeat from * until you have 6 loops; join with a slip st in first ch.
Round 1: Do not ch at beginning of round. Using only the thin sections of the yarn and working 1 sc per thin section, letting the thick sections form loops as before, work 2 sc in each loop around – 12 loops.
Round 2: Do not ch at beginning of round. Using only the thin sections of the yarn and working 1 sc per thin section, work 2 sc in each sc around – 24 loops. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
FINISHING (Optional)
With sewing needle and thread, attach a pin back or clasp to the back of the flower.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 368 Paddy Green
Safety pin, sewing needle and matching thread, yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parenthesis the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Clover measures 2" [5 cm] at widest point.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in first sc to join.
Round 2: *Ch 3, (tr, 2 dc, tr) in next sc, ch 3, slip st in next sc; repeat from * around, ch 8, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 6 ch, slip st in first ch of beginning ch-3. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in ends. Using needle and matching thread, sew safety pin to back of Clover.

pattern_name: Aunt Lydia's No Problem-ma Llama Appliqué
materials: Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 001 White A, 226 Natural B, 856 Peacock C, 494 Victory Red D, 422 Golden Yellow E, and 12 Black F
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 2.75 mm [US C-2]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Llama measures 3½" [9 cm] across; from top of Head to bottom of Feet is 4½" [11.5 cm] high.
gauge: Approximately 7 sc = 1" [2.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
LLAMA
Body and Head
Beginning at bottom of Body, with A, ch 18.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn—17 sc.
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—19 sc.
Rows 3-11: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 12: (Begin Neck) Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, sc2tog; turn (leave remaining sts unworked)—6 sts.
Rows 13-19: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn—6 sc.
Row 20: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in last 4 sc; turn—5 sts.
Row 21: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, sc2tog; turn—4 sts.
Row 22: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn—4 sc.
Row 23: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, sc2tog, (Begin Ears) ch 3, slip st in 3rd ch from hook, slip st in side of last sc2tog; ch 3, slip st in 3rd ch from hook, slip st in same sc2tog as before. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Leg (make 2)
With B, ch 2.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn—3 sc.
Rows 2-6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. At end of Row 6, fasten off, leaving end for sewing.
Face
With B, ch 2.
Row 1 (Right Side): Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn—3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc—4 sc. Fasten off, leaving end for sewing.
Blanket
With C, ch 4.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next ch, 3 sc in last ch; working on opposite side of ch, sc in next 2 chs; turn—7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc, sc in last 2 sc; turn—10 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in last 2 sc—13 sc. Fasten off.
Row 4: With D, work in back loops only of Row 3. Join with a sc in first sc (see Special Stitches), sc in next sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 3 times, sc in last 2 sc—16 sc. Fasten off, leaving end for sewing.
Row 5: With E, work in remaining front loops only of Row 3. Join with a slip st in first sc (see Special Stitches), slip st in each front loop across—13 slip sts. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Assembly
Referring to photo for placement, sew Legs and Blanket to Llama. Using double strand of A, embroider 5 loop stitches at top of back of Body for Tail. Sew Face to side of Head under Ears. Using single strand of F, embroider with couched stitches to create closed Eye and with straight stitches to create Mouth.

materials: STITCH NATION by Debbie Stoller™ Full o’ Sheep™: 1 ball each 2605 Honeycomb A, 2640 Thyme B and 2350 Hazelnut C.
Crochet Hook 5 mm [US H-8] and 8 mm [US L-11].
Sharp yarn needle, 1½” bar pin, fiberfill stuffing, straight pins.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Flower measures 8” in diameter before felting, 5 ½” after felting.
gauge: Gauge is not important, but the stitches need to be loose to felt the yarn successfully.
instructions:
Note: Join rounds with a slip stitch.

SPECIAL ABBREVIATIONS
3-ch-picot = Ch 3, insert hook in front loop (horizontal bar) of the dc just made and in the left strand (vertical bar) of the same st, yo and pull through all three loops.

SUNFLOWER
Petals
Round 1:  With A, ch 2, 6 sc in second ch from the hook; join to first sc – 6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc; join to first sc – 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc] 6 times; join to first sc – 18 sc.
Round 4: (First row of petals), working in the front loops only of the previous round, slip st into first sc, [ch 5, working in the back hump of the chain, sc in second ch from the hook and the next 3 ch, slip st in next sc] 17 times; ch 5, working in the back hump of the chain, sc in second ch from the hook and the next 3 ch, slip st into back loop of first sc – 18 petals.
Round 5: Working behind the petals and in the back loops only of round 3, ch 1, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times; join to first sc – 24 sc.
Round 6: (Second row of petals) working into both loops of round 5, [ch 6, sc in the back hump of the second ch from the hook and the next 4 ch, slip st in next sc] 23 times; ch 6, sc in the back hump of the second ch from the hook and the next 4 ch; join to first petal – 24 petals.
Fasten off.  Weave in ends.

Sunflower Center
Round 1:  With C, ch 2, 6 sc in second ch from the hook; join to first sc – 6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc; join to first sc – 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join to first sc – 12 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Fasten off.  Weave in ends.

Leaves (Make 2)
Round 1:  With B, ch 4, 8 dc into first chain; do not join, turn.
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in first dc, hdc in next dc, dc in next 2 dc; (3 dc, 3-ch-picot, 2 dc) in next dc; dc in next 2 dc, hdc in next dc, hdc in top of turning ch, ch 2, slip st into top of starting ch.
Fasten off.  Weave in ends.

Backing
Round 1:  With C, ch 2, 6 sc in second ch from the hook; join to first sc – 6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc; join to first sc – 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times; join to first sc – 18 sc.
Round 4:  Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times; join to first sc – 24 sc.
Fasten off.  Weave in ends.

Felting
Before assembling the flower, put the pieces into pillowcases and tie closed. Place them in a washing machine with hot water and a small amount of detergent. Check during the wash cycle regularly until desired amount of felting is achieved. Rinse soap and squeeze out excess water. To shape Sunflower, make a small aluminum ball and flatten one side. Place in the middle of the sunflower and pin or tie the petals around the ball and let dry. Block remaining pieces into desired shapes and let dry.

ASSEMBLY
With C, sew the sunflower center into the middle of the flower leaving a small opening; stuff center with fiber fill; finish sewing in place. arrange leaves on back of flower; pin into place and stitch to the sunflower with B. Place backing on the sunflower over the leaves; pin and stitch into place with C. Sew bar pin onto back.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Cotton (1.75 oz/50 g; 80 yds/73 m)
Main Color (MC) Country Red (01530)  1 ball or 13 yds/12 m
Contrast A Off White (01002) 1 ball or 6 yds/5.5 m
Size U.S. 8 (5 mm) knitting needles or size needed to obtain gauge.
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook for Stem.
abbreviations: Ssk = Slip next 2 stitches one at a time. Pass them back onto left-hand needle, then knit through the back loops together.
W&T = (Wrap and Turn). Bring yarn to front of work. Slip next stitch purlwise. Bring yarn to back of work. Slip stitch back onto left-hand needle. Turn.
measurements: Approx 5" [12.5 cm] long.
gauge: 18 sts and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
With A, cast on 6 sts, leaving end 6" [15 cm] long.
1st row: (RS). Knit.
2nd and alt rows: Purl.
3rd row: Cast off 3 sts. Knit to end of row. 3 sts.
5th row: Cast on 6 sts. Knit to last 2 sts. W&T.
7th row: K1. K2tog. Knit to last 3 sts. W&T.
9th row: K1. K2tog. Knit to last 4 sts. W&T.
11th row: Cast on 4 sts. Knit to last 5 sts. W&T.
13th row: K1. K2tog. Knit to last 4 sts. W&T.
15th row: K1. K2tog. Knit to last 3 sts. W&T.
17th row: Knit to last 2 sts. W&T.
19th row: Knit to last st. W&T.
21st row: Cast off 4 sts. Knit to end of row. 5 sts.
23rd row: Cast on 6 sts. Knit to end of row.
25th to 38th rows: As 7th to 20th rows.
39th row: Cast off 5 sts. Knit to end of row. 6 sts.
40th and alt rows: Purl.
41st row: Cast on 4 sts. Knit to last 5 sts. W&T.
43rd row: K1. K2tog. Knit to last 4 sts. W&T.
45th row: K1. K2tog. Knit to last 3 sts. W&T.
47th row: Cast on 4 sts. Knit to last 2 sts. W&T.
49th row: K1. K2tog. Knit to last st. W&T.
51st row: K1. K2tog. Knit to last 2 sts. W&T.
53rd row: Knit to last 3 sts. W&T.
55th row: Knit to last 4 sts. W&T.
57th row: Cast off 6 sts. Knit to end of row. 4 sts.
59th row: Cast on 3 sts. Knit to last 2 sts. W&T.
61st row: Cast off to last 2 sts. ssk. Fasten off leaving end 6" [15 cm] long.
Tie the two ends tog to join each side of Leaf tog.
With A and crochet hook, make chain approx 2" [5 cm] long for stem. Cont to embroider in sl st up the central part of Leaf, stopping approx ¾" [2 cm] from the tip, to form main vein. Fasten off.
Using photo as a guide, embroider veins with A on Leaf using chain st.

materials: Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 4 ins [10 cm] wide.
gauge: 15 sc and 17 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Flower Motif (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd:6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd:Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. Fasten off.
First Petal: 1st row:Join B with sl st to front loop only of any sc. *Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in front loop only of next sc. 4 sc for petal. Turn.
Next 3 rows:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc of petal. Turn.
Next row:Ch 1. (Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made) twice. Fasten off.*
Second Petal: **Rejoin B with sl st to front loop of next unworked sc of 2nd rnd. Rep from * to * once.**
Third to Sixth Petals: Rep from ** to ** 4 times more. 6 petals.
Glue Flower Motifs to flip flops.

materials: Red Heart® Chic Sheep by Marly Bird™: 1 ball 5907 Sangria
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm [US I-9]
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Rose measures approximately 2" (5 cm) across.
gauge: Gauge is not essential for this item.
instructions:
Ch 18.
Row 1: Skip 5 ch, V-st in 6th ch from hook, * skip 2 foundation ch, ch 2, V-st in next ch; repeat from * to end, turn – 5 V-sts.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), 5 dc in first V-st, [sc in next ch-2 space, 6 dc in next V-st] twice, [sc in next ch-2 space, 9 dc in next V-st] twice, sc in last space.
Fasten off leaving a 10" (25.5 cm) tail.
FINISHING
Using yarn needle and tail, with right side facing, and beginning with largest petal, roll your petals inward, sewing foundation edge as you go. Use yarn tails to sew on to a pin or barrette backing, or directly onto a garment or accessory.

materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
Contrast A Cyber Leaf (2021) 1 ball (2 Granny Squares)
Contrast B Pink Punch (2001) 1 ball (2 Granny Squares)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: 1 Motif: Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
gauge: Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
Notes
• Motifs using Granny Square™ All in One™ begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4” [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• Each color aligns with 1 rnd in the Motif with 5 colors in total. If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• When Motif is complete, cut yarn where Color 5 (longest color rep) ends, leaving a tail for weaving in. Begin next Motif with Color 1 and repeat 5 rnds for each Motif.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• Join all rnds with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.

GRANNY SQUARE ALL IN ONE MOTIFS (make 2 of each in A and B):
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
Fasten off.

ASSEMBLY
With length of black from A, using Whipstitch, sew tog through back loops only as shown in photo. Attach to back of jacket.

STITCH KEY
= chain (ch)
= slip stitch (sl st)
= double crochet (dc)

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 1 White A and 12 Black B
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Skeleton Applique measures 12” [30 cm] tall
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark Page 1 of 2
Dancin’ Skeleton 
Appliqué
Crochet a skeleton appliqué and sew it  
onto a t-shirt. It’s a spooky, groovy idea for 
the Halloween season or for Day of the  
Dead events!
Row 18: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 19: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 15 
sts, sc2tog – 16 sts.
Row 20: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 21: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 13 
sts, sc2tog – 14 sts.
Row 22: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 23: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 11 
sts, sc2tog – 12 sts.
Row 24: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 9 
sts, sc2tog – 10 sts.
Row 25: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 7 
sts, sc2tog – 8 sts.
Row 26: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 5 
sts, sc2tog – 6 sts. Do Not Fasten Off.
Edging: Ch 1, sc evenly spaced around entire 
Head, slip st in first sc to join. 
Fasten off. 
BODY
Body is worked along foundation ch to make 
spine, from top to bottom on first side and 
from bottom back to top along opposite side to 
form hips, ribs and shoulders.
Holding 2 strands of A together, ch 27 for 
Spine. 
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 5 
ch to form neck, ch 12, slip st in 2nd ch from 
hook and next 11 ch for shoulder, slip st in 
next ch of foundation ch, slip st in next 4 ch, 
[ch 10, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 9 
ch, slip st in next ch of foundation ch, slip st 
in next 2 ch] 3 times for 3 ribs, ch 7, slip 
st in 2nd ch from hook and next 6 ch for rib, slip 
st in next ch of foundation ch, slip st in next 4 
ch, ch 12, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 
11 ch for hip, slip st in next ch of foundation 
ch, turn work to work along opposite edge of 
foundation ch, ch 12, slip st in 2nd ch from 
hook and next 11 ch for second hip, slip st in 
same ch of foundation ch, slip st in next 4 ch, 
ch 7, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 6 
ch for rib, slip st in next ch of foundation ch, 
[slip st in next 2 ch  ch 10, slip st in 2nd ch 
from hook and next 9 ch, slip st in next ch of 
foundation ch] 3 times for 3 ribs, slip st in next 
4 ch, ch 12, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and 
next 11 ch for shoulder, slip st in next ch of 
foundation ch, slip st in remaining chs to first 
st. Fasten off.
ARMS (Make 2)
Holding 2 strands of A together, ch 21. 
Row 1: Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd 
ch from hook and each ch across – 20 sts. 
Row 2: Ch 1, do not turn, sc 4 sts in last ch.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st – 4 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 3 
sts – 3 sts.
Row 5: Slip st in row end next to last st just 
made, ch 3, turn, slip st in 2nd ch from hook 
and next ch to form first finger, [slip st in next 
st, ch 4, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 
ch] 3 times to form 3 fingers, slip st in row 
end next to last st just made, ch 3, turn, slip st 
in 2nd ch from hook and next ch, to form last 
finger. 
Fasten off. 
LEGS (Make 2)
Holding 2 strands of A together, ch 21. 
Row 1: Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd 
ch from hook and each ch across – 20 sts. 
RIGHT FOOT 
Holding 2 strands of A together, ch 7. 
Row 1: Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd 
ch from hook and each ch across – 6 sts. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in 
next st, turn to work along opposite edge of 
foundation ch, sc in next 4 sts – 10 sts.
Round 3: Working in continuous rounds, 2 sc 
in first st, sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next 2 sts, 
sc in next 5 sts, slip st in next st.
Row 4: [Ch 3, slip st in same space and in 
next space] 4 times for 4 toes, ch 4, slip st in 
same place and in next st for big toe. 
Fasten off. 
LEFT FOOT 
Holding 2 strands of A together, ch 7. 
Row 1: Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd 
ch from hook and each ch across – 6 sts. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 5 st, 2 sc in 
next st, turn to work along opposite edge of 
foundation ch, sc in next 4 sts – 10 sts.
Round 3: Working in continuous rounds, 2 sc 
in first st, sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next 2 sts, 
sc in next 5 sts, slip st in next st.
Row 4: Ch 4, slip st in same place and in next 
st for big toe, [ch 3, slip st in same space and 
in next space] 4 times for 4 toes. 
Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Following photo and using 1 strand of B, 
embroider mouth on Head with straight 
stitches. Sew on buttons for eyes. Embroider 
eye brows above eyes. 
For best results, lay tee-shirt flat and insert 
a piece of cardboard inside and smooth the 
shirt front. Referring to the photo, pin Skeleton 
pieces to upper middle portion of shirt. 
Arrange limbs as desired. Carefully hand-
stitch pieces using matching thread, being 
careful not to pull the thread too tightly in 
order to prevent puckering.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Super Craft Kit
Kit includes 12 balls (50 g/ 1.7 oz each; 600 g/21 oz total), yardage (85 m/93 yds each; 1020 m/1116 yds total)
Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Hot glue gun and glue sticks (optional)
abbreviations: Sc3tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 3 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Flower: Approx 1¾" [4.5 cm] wide. Bow: Approx 2½" [6.5 cm] wide by 1¾" [4.5 cm] tall. Heart: Approx 1½" [4 cm] at widest point.
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
FLOWER
See diagram on page 2.
Shown in photos as follows:
With H as Color 1 and E as Color 2.
With L as Color 1 and I as Color 2.
With D as Color 1 and A as Color 2.
With J as Color 1 and C as Color 2.
With F as Color 1 and K as Color 2.

With Color 1, beg using magic loop method demonstrated here.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 12 sc in ring. Join Color 2 with sl st to first sc. Break Color 1.
2nd rnd: With Color 2, (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) all in same sp as sl st. Sl st in next sc. *(1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) all in next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to base of first hdc. Fasten off.
BOW
See diagram on page 2.
Shown in photos in B, F, J, L, and E.
Ch 6.

1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 3 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Turn. 1 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 3 sc in next sc. Turn. 3 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
7th and 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Do not fasten off.
Final rnd: Turn work. (Work 7 sc evenly across long edge of Bow. Work 2 sc in next corner sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Work 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc of rnd. Fasten off.
Bow Tie
Ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off. 5 sc.
Wrap Tie around Bow as shown in photo. Join first st to last st of row to secure, with join on WS of work.

HEART
Shown in photos in A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H.
Beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: (Sl st. 1 dc. 3 tr. 3 dc. 1 tr. 3 dc. 3 tr. 1 dc) all in ring. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off. Cinch loop closed tightly.

FINISHING
Sew Charms to socks as shown in photo, or apply to Clog charm backs using hot glue.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 12 Black
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Jack o’ Lantern Applique is 5” [12.5 cm] tall, sewn in place
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
MOUTH
Mouth is worked from one corner to opposite corner.
Holding 2 strands of yarn together, ch 5. 
Row 1: Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 4 sts. 
*Shape Tooth
Row 2: Ch 5, turn, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch, leave 4 sts from previous row unworked – 4 sts.
Rows 3-5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Repeat from * to make 4 Teeth.
Shape Opposite Corner of Mouth
Last Row: Ch 5, turn, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch, leave 4 sts from previous row unworked – 4 sts.
Fasten off. 
FINISHING
For best results, lay tee-shirt flat and insert a piece of cardboard inside and smooth the shirt front. Referring to the photo, pin Eyes and Mouth to upper middle portion of shirt. Carefully hand-stitch pieces using matching thread, being careful not to pull the thread too tightly in order to prevent puckering.
NOTE
Pieces are worked with thread held doubled throughout.
SPECIAL ABBREVIATIONS
sc2tog: [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
EYES (Make 2)
Holding 2 strands of yarn together, ch 12. 
Row 1: Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 11 sts. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 8 sts, sc2tog – 9 sts. 
Row 3: Ch 1 turn, sc in each st across.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog – 7 sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog – 5 sts.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog – 3 sts.
Row 9: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 10: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc2tog – 1 st. 
Edging Round: Ch 1, sc evenly spaced around entire piece, join with slip st to first sc.  
Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Grace (50 g / 1.75 oz) 61104 (Azure) 1 ball makes 6 Small Appliques and 2 Large.
Size 3.75 mm (U.S. F or 5) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
measurements: Small Appliqué: Approx 2 ins [5 cm] in diameter. Large Appliqué: Approx 3 ½ ins [9 cm] in diameter.
gauge: 24 sc and 26 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions: SMALL APPLIQUÉ (Make 6). Ch 3. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 1st rnd: Ch 2. 12 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc. 2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as hdc and ch 1). *1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of ch 3. 24 sts. 3rd rnd:Ch 1. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in next ch-1 sp. *Sl st in next hdc. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off. LARGE APPLIQUÉ (Make 2). Ch 3. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 1st rnd: Ch 2. 12 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc. 2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc. 3rd rnd: Ch 5 (counts as hdc and ch 3). *Miss next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Ch 3. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 5. 4th rnd: Sl st in first ch-3 sp. Ch 1. *4 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 5th rnd: Ch 1. *Miss next sc. 5 dc in next sc. Miss next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with sl st in first st. Fasten off. FINISHING: With sewing needle and thread, sew beads to Appliqués in assorted patterns as shown. Position Appliqués on tank top as shown in picture (or as desired). Sew Appliqués to tank top.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® “Bamboo Ice™” Size 3: 1 ball each 3702 Pink Ice A, 3631 Green Tea Ice B, 3001 Icicle C, 3201 Lemon Ice D.
abbreviations: A, B, C, D = Color A, Color B, Color C, Color D
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Pink flower measures 5” diameter. White flower measures 4¾” diameter. Yellow flower measures 4½” diameter.
gauge: One petal of pink flower = 2¼” long. Gauge is not critical for this project. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PINK FLOWER
Petals (make 7)
With A, ch 9.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook (lower end of petal), hdc in next 2 ch, dc in next 4 ch, 5 dc in last ch (petal tip); working across opposite side of foundation ch, dc in next 4 ch, hdc in next 2 ch, sc in last ch, turn—19 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, dc in next 3 sts, 5 dc in next st, dc in next 3 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, sc in last 3 sts, turn—23 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, dc in next 5 sts, 5 dc in next st, dc in next 5 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, sc in last 3 sts—27 sts. Fasten off.
Leaves
With B, ch 12; taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, work 18 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same sc as join, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same sc as join, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same sc as join, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same sc as join, sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc.
Round 6: *Ch 9, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, tr in next 5 ch (beginning of first leaf), skip next 3 sc of Round 5, slip st in next sc, TURN, skip slip st just made; working across leaf sts, sc in next 7 sts of leaf, 3 sc in next sc (tip of leaf); work 8 sc evenly spaced across opposite side of ch-9, slip st in st at base of ch-9, TURN, skip slip st just made, sc in next sc, hdc in next 2 sc, dc in next 5 sc, 5 dc in next sc, dc in next 5 sc, hdc in next 2 sc, sc in next sc, slip st in last sc of leaf, slip st in next 2 sc of Round 5; repeat from * 2 more times. Fasten off.
Flower Center
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join, work in a continuous spiral—6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: *Slip st in next sc, ch 10, 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 8 ch, skip next sc of Round 2; repeat from * around. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With Right Side facing, arrange petals in a circle, with lower ends of petals together and sides of petals overlapping. With A, sew petals together. Place petals in center of leaves. Place flower center in center of petals. With A, sew leaves and flower center in place. Weave in ends.
WHITE FLOWER
Front Petals
With B, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join, work in a continuous spiral—6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Rounds 3 and 4: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc around. Fasten off B.
Round 5: With Right Side facing, working in unworked front loops of Round 2, join C with slip st in first st, ch 1, hdc in same st, hdc in next st, ch 1, [(slip st, ch 1, hdc) in next st, hdc in next st, ch 1] 5 times (6 petals made); working in unworked front loops of Round 3, [(slip st, ch 2, 2 dc) in next st, 2 dc in next st, ch 2] 6 times (6 more petals made); working in front loops only of Round 4, [(slip st, ch 3, 2 tr) in next st, 2 tr in next st, ch 3] 6 times, slip st in next st. Fasten off.
First Layer of Leaves
With Right Side of front petals facing, fold petals forward to work in unworked back loops of Round 4. Join B with sc in first unworked back loop.
Round 1 (Right Side): Working in unworked back loops of Round 4, sc in same st as joining, 2 sc in each of remaining 11 sc—24 sc.
Round 2: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 3: *(Slip st, ch 1, hdc) in next sc, 2 dc in next sc, (2 tr, ch 2, sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 tr) in next sc, 2 dc in next sc, (hdc, ch 1, slip st) in next sc; repeat from * around—6 leaves.
Back Petals (make 6)
With C, ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, 6 dc in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, dc in next ch, hdc in next ch, sc in last ch, turn—12 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sts, 2 sc in next 4 sts, sc in last 4 sts—16 sts. Fasten off.
Second Layer of Leaves
With B, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join, work in a continuous spiral—6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: Work 2 sc in each sc around—36 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—42 sc.
Round 6: *Slip st in next sc, (sc, ch 1, hdc) in next sc, 2 dc in next sc, (2 tr, ch 2, sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 tr) in next sc, 2 dc in next sc, (hdc, ch 1, sc) in next sc, slip st in next sc; repeat from * around—6 leaves.
Round 7: *Skip next slip st, sc in each st and ch to next ch-2 space, 3 sc in next ch-2 space (tip of leaf), sc in each st and ch to next slip st, skip next slip st; repeat from * around. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With Right Side facing, arrange back petals in a circle, evenly spaced between front petals and first layer of leaves. With C, sew back petals in place. Place assembled flower into second layer of leaves, arranging the leaves of the second layer between leaves of the first layer. With B, sew second layer of leaves to flower. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
gauge: Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
Visit this link for additional info about Red Heart All in One Granny Square: here.
Notes:
• Motifs using Granny Square All in One begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• Each color aligns with 1 round (rnd) in the Motif with 5 colors in total. If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some stitches (sts) and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• When Motif is complete, cut yarn where Color 5 (longest color rep) ends, leaving a tail for weaving in. Begin next Motif with Color 1 and repeat 5 rnds for each Motif.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• Join all rnds with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.
Granny Square All in One Motifs (make 2)
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join.
Fasten off.
Sew to knees or pockets as shown. Patches can be used anywhere else that needs a little crochet love.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball White
measurements: Flower measures 1¾” (4cm) wide.
gauge: Flower Center measures approximately 1” (2.5cm) across. Gauge is not critical to this project.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
Flowered Wedding Favor Box
Crochet these little flowers for a beautiful personal touch on gifts from the bride to wedding party or guests. For other occasions, do them in bright or pastel colors and use wherever you wish.
Notes
All pieces are crocheted in joined rounds; do not turn unless otherwise indicated.
Flower is crocheted in 2 parts, then sewn together and tied to lid of gift box.
FLOWER
Petals
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 2, work 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc, tighten beginning tail to close center – 10 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, (sc, ch 5, sc, ch 1) in first st, [skip next st, (sc, ch 5, sc, ch 1) in next st] 4 times; join with slip st in first st – 5 petals.
Round 3: Ch 1, [(sc, hdc, 4 dc, ch 2, 4 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-5 space] 5 times; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off.
Flower Center
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 2, [sc, ch 3] 5 times in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first st to create mini flower shape, tighten beginning tail to close center – 5 sc, 5 ch-3 spaces.
Round 2: [Ch 2, (dc, tr, ch 1, tr, dc) in next ch-3 space, ch 2, slip st in next sc] 5 times – 5 petals. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Using photo as a guide, sew Flower Center to Flower Petal, leaving tails to attach piece to box. Weave in remaining ends. Wrap box lid with ribbon as desired. Poke small holes in lid. Thread tails through holes and tie Flower Trim securely to lid. Flower Trim may also be tied or sewn to ribbon, if desired.
Designed by Andee Graves
