materials: Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 422 Golden Yellow A and 401 Orchid Pink B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 2.75 mm [US C-2]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Rose measures 2½" [6.5 cm] diameter.
gauge: Rounds 1-3 = 1" [2.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Beginning at center, with A, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook (do not join)—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of Round and move marker up as each Round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc. Fasten off.
Round 4: With B, work in back loops only for this Round. Join with a sc in back loop of first sc of Round 3 (see Special Stitch), sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, *sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: *Ch 3, skip 1 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first loop—12 ch-3 loops.
Round 6: Ch 1, [sc, hdc, dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-3 loop around; join with slip st in first sc—12 petals. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Round 7: Join B with a sc in any unworked front loop of Round 3; [ch 1, 2 dc in next front loop, ch 1, sc in next front loop] 7 times, ch 1, 2 dc in last front loop, ch 1; join with slip st in first sc—9 petals. Fasten off, leaving end for sewing.

materials: RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™: 1 ball of 100 Lily
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Each Letter measures 2” [5 cm] tall
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
A to Z in Crochet
Use these crocheted alphabet letters to personalize or send a message on your creations. Each letter is two inches tall and can be sewn or applied with fabric glue.

A
Ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch for center bar, sc in next 3 ch of ch-8, turn, ch 4, slip st in tip of center bar, ch 5, turn, sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 3 ch, sc in slip st, sc in last 4 ch, slip st in first st.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

B
Ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 5, turn, skip 3 sc, sc in next sc, ch 6, skip next 2 sc, slip st in last sc.
Row 3: Turn, skip slip st, sc in next 6 ch, slip st in sc, sc in last 5 ch, slip st in edge of Row 1.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

C
Ch 13.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 12 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Shape into a “C” while sewing in place.

D
Ch 17.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 6 ch, 3 sc in next ch, sc in next 7 ch, 2 sc in last ch, slip st in first st to join.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

E
Ch 8.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook, [ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, sc in next 3 ch of ch-8] twice, ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, slip st in side of last sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

F
Ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, sc in next 3 ch of ch-8, ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, slip st in last ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

G
Ch 15.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook, ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, slip st in same space as slip st, sc in remaining 13 ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Shape into a “G” while sewing in place.

H
Left Side
Ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch for center bar, sc in next 3 ch of ch-8.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Right Side
Ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch across – 7 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Sew Sides together along center bar.

I
Ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 7 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

J
Ch 10.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, sc in side of last sc along ch-10, ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, slip st in same sc alongside.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Shape into a “J” while sewing in place.

K
Ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 3 ch, slip st in last sc along ch-8, ch 4, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 2 ch, slip st in same sc alongside, sc in remaining ch of ch-8.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

L
Ch 12.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch, skip next ch, sc in last 7 ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

M
Ch 21.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 9 ch, ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 3 ch, sc in remaining 10 ch of ch-21.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Shape into a “M” while sewing in place.

N
Ch 25.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 6 ch, skip next ch, sc in ch in next 8 ch, skip 1 ch, sc in each remaining ch across.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Shape into a “N” while sewing in place.

O
Ch 17, slip st in first ch to join.
Round 1: Sc in each ch around, slip st in first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

P
Ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 5, turn, skip first 3 sc, slip st in next sc, leave remaining sts unworked.
Row 3: Turn, sc in each ch of ch-5, slip st in last ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Q
Ch 17, slip st in first ch to join.
Round 1: Ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, sc in each ch around, slip st in first ch, ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook and next ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

R
Ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 5, turn, skip 3 sc, sc next sc for center sc, ch 5, turn, sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 3 ch, slip st in center sc, sc in 4 ch of first ch-5 space, slip st in edge of Row 1.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

S
Ch 17.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 16 sc.
Shape into a “S” while sewing in place.

T
Ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, sc in side of last sc along ch-8, ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, slip st in same sc alongside.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

U
Ch 17.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 16 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Shape into a “U” while sewing in place.

V
Ch 18.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 7 ch, skip next ch, sc in remaining 8 ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Shape into a “V” while sewing in place.

W
Work as for M, reversing direction while sewing in place.

X
Make 2
Ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 7 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Shape pieces into a “X”, crossing in center, while sewing in place.

Y
Row 1: [Ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch] twice, slip st in first ch, ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, slip st in same slip st.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Z
Ch 16.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, skip next ch, sc in next 5 ch, skip next ch, sc in remaining 4 ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Shape into a “Z” while sewing in place.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® "Luster Sheen™": 1 Skein each 0517 Turquoise (A) 0915 Cherry Red (B), 0227 Buttercup (C), 0001 White (D), 0518 Light Mulberry (E)
Two 3/16”/.5cm black buttons – one for each bird
Coordinated sewing thread and needle to sew on T-shirts as desired
measurements: Bird measures from beak to tail 3 3/4” long
gauge: Not needed for this project.
instructions:
Bird
Note The head, body and wing are worked separately and sewn together with yarn tails. The tail and beak are worked directly onto the bird.

Body  With A, chain 7.

Round 1: (right side) Slip stitch in 2nd chain from hook, single crochet in next chain, half double crochet in next chain, double crochet in next chain, triple crochet in next chain, 4 double crochet in last chain; working in opposite side of chains, triple crochet in next chain, double crochet in next chain, half double crochet in next chain, single crochet in next chain, slip stitch in last chain – 14 stitches (including slip stitches). Join with a slip stitch in first slipped stitch.
Round 2: Chain 3 (counts as first double crochet), double crochet in same slip stitch as joining, 2 double crochet in each of next 13 stitches – 28 double crochet. Join with slip stitch in 3rd chain of beginning chain-3. Fasten off.

Head
With A, chain 3.
Round 1: (right side) Work 9 double crochet in 3rd chain from hook. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.

Beak
With right side of head facing and C, insert hook in 5th double crochet on head (for left-facing bird) or in 3rd double crochet on head (for right-facing bird) and draw up a loop, chain 1, double crochet in next double crochet. Fasten off. Using end of yarn from head, sew flat part of head (beginning chains and last double crochet) to rounded part of body (10th-12th double crochet on Round 2 of body for left facing bird and 17th-19th double crochet on Round 2 of body for right-facing bird.

Wing
With B, chain 7.

Round 1: Work same as Round 1 of body. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.

Tail  
Row 1: With right side of body facing, join B with slip stitch in first double crochet on Round 2 of body (for left-facing bird) or in next to last double crochet on Round 2 (for right-facing bird), chain 3 (counts as double crochet), double crochet in same stitch as joining, 2 double crochet in next stitch – 4 double crochet. Chain 3 (counts as double crochet on next row), turn.
Row 2: Double crochet in next 3 stitches – 4 double crochet. Chain 1, turn.
Row 3: Work (half double crochet, slip stitch) in first double crochet, (half double crochet, slip stitch) in each of next 2 double crochet, (half double crochet, slip stitch) in 3rd chain of turning chain 3 – 4 half double crochet and 4 slip stitches. Fasten off.

Finishing
Weave in all ends. Sew wing to body. Sew button to head for eye. Pin assembled bird(s) to shirt as shown in photo or as desired and stitch in place.

FLOWER  
With either C or E, (center of flower), chain 2.
Round 1: (right side) Work 10 single crochet in 2nd chain from hook – 10 single crochet. Join with slip stitch to first single crochet. Fasten off.
Round 2: With right side facing, join D with slip stitch in any single crochet, double crochet in same stitch as joining (double crochet, slip stitch) in next stitch; *(slip stitch, double crochet) in next stitch, (double crochet, slip stitch) in next stitch; repeat from * 3 times more – 5 petals made. Join with slip stitch to first slip stitch. Fasten off.

Finishing
Weave in ends. Pin flower(s) to shirt as desired and stitch in place.

pattern_name: Ho Ho Holiday Christmas Crochet Appliques
materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Super Craft Kit™
Tree - Jade or Shocking Pink or Spring Green 1 ball or 17 yds/15.5 m
Heart - Cherry Red or Royal or Shocking Pink 1 ball or 15 yds/4.5 m
Snowflake - Soft White 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Gnome Beard - Soft White or Gray Heather 1 ball or 8 yds/7.5 m
Gnome Striped Hat - Contrast A Jade or Spring Green 1 ball or 6 yds/5.5 m
Gnome Striped Hat - Contrast B Shocking Pink or Royal 1 ball or 6 yds/5.5 m
Gnome Solid Hat - Cherry Red 1 ball or 6 yds/5.5 m
Gnome Nose - Contrast C Cherry Red or Shocking Pink or Caffé Late 1 ball or 6 yds/5.5 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2(3)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 2 (3) times. Yoh and draw through all 3 (4) loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Tree: Approx 5" x 6" [12.5 x 15 cm], Heart: Approx 5" x 5" [12.5 x 12.5 cm], Gnome: Approx 4" x 8" [10 cm x 20.5 cm], Snowflake: Approx 4" x 4" [10 x 10 cm]
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
TREE 
See Diagram on page 3.
Right Side of Tree
With Jade or Shocking Pink or Spring Green, ch 7.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn
4th row: Ch 6. Working in back of chain, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 4 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. Leave rem 3 sts unworked.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Turn. 6 sts.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts.
8th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. 4 sts.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Turn.
10th row: Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. 7 sc.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts.
12th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. 5 sts.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts.
14th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 3 sts.
15th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn.
16th row: Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. 5 sc.
17th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts.
18th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 3 sts.
19th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 2 sts.
20th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 
Fasten off, leaving a 16" [40.6 cm] tail.
Left Side of Tree
With RS facing join yarn with sl st at last unworked sc of 3rd row.
1st row: Ch 6. Working in back of chain,  1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 4 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc of 4th row of Right Side Of Tree.Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc of 6th row of Right Side Of Tree. Turn. 6 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc of 8th row of Right Side Of Tree. Turn. 4 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Turn.
7th row: Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc of 10th row of Right Side Of Tree. Turn. 7 sc.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts.
9th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc of 12th row of Right Side Of Tree. Turn. 5 sts.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts.
11th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc of 14th row of Right Side Of Tree. Turn. 3 sts.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn.
13th row: Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc of 16th row of Right Side Of Tree. Turn. 5 sc.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts.
15th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc of 18th row of Right Side Of Tree. Turn. 3 sts.
16th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 2 sts.
17th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Sl st to top of Right Side Of Tree. Fasten off.
EMBELLISHED CROCHET GIFT TAGS
EMBELLISHED CROCHET GIFT TAGS  Designed by Joan Barnett ALC0518-034015M  |  November 22, 2022
GRANNY SQUARE HEART
Notes: 
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
With Cherry Red or Royal or Shocking Pink, make Magic Loop. 
1st rnd: Ch 3. 3 dc in magic loop. (Ch 2. 4 dc) 3 times in magic 
loop. Ch 2. Join. Pull tail to tighten, closing center hole.
2nd rnd: Sl st through back loop only in each dc to corner ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 2. 4 dc) in same sp as last sl st. [(Ch 2. 
4 dc) twice in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 2. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 
3 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 4 dc. 2 sc in next 
ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 4 dc. Sl st in next ch-2 sp. (Skip 
next 4 dc. 12 tr in next ch-2 sp. Skip next 4 dc. Sl st in next 
ch-2 sp) twice. 1 sc in each of next 4 dc. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 
Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
GRANNY SQUARE GNOME
Notes: 
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
See Diagrams on page 5.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 12 Black A and 332 Hot Pink B
AUNT LYDIA’S® Fashion Crochet Metallics, Size 5: 1 ball 410S Silver/Silver C
hand sewing needle and matching thread
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Kitty Applique is 6” tall x 5½” wide [15 x 14 cm]
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Row 35: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Shape First Ear
Row 36: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 8 sts, leave remaining sts unworked – 8 sts.
Row 37: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 38: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 5 sts, sc2tog – 6 sts.
Row 39: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 40: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog – 4 sts.
Row 41: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 42: Ch 1, turn, [sc2tog] twice – 2 sts.
Fasten off.
Shape Second Ear
Row 36: Skip next 4 unworked sts on Row 36, join yarn in next st, ch 1, sc in same st, sc in next 7 sts – 8 sts.
Rows 37-42: Work as for First Ear. Do Not Fasten Off.
Edging: Ch 1, sc evenly spaced around entire Head, slip st in first sc to join. Fasten off.
NOSE
Holding 2 strands of B together, ch 8. 
Row 1: Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 7 sts. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog – 5 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog – 3 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc2tog – 1 st.
Edging: Ch 1, sc evenly spaced around entire Nose, slip st in first sc to join. Fasten off.
KITTY HEAD
Holding 2 strands of A together, ch 25. 
Row 1: Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 24 sts. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] twice, sc in next 16 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] twice – 28 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] twice, sc in next 20 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] twice – 32 sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] twice, sc in next 24 sts, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] twice – 36 sts.
Rows 7-18: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 19: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next st, sc2tog] twice, sc in next 24 sts, [sc2tog, sc in next st] twice – 32 sts.
Row 20: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 21: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next st, sc2tog] twice, sc in next 20 sts, [sc2tog, sc in next st] twice – 28 sts.
Rows 22-31: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 32: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next st, sc2tog] twice, sc in next 16 sts, [sc2tog, sc in next st] twice – 24 sts.
Row 33: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 34: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next st, sc2tog] twice, sc in next 12 sts, [sc2tog, sc in next st] twice – 20 sts.
FINISHING
Following photo, sew Nose in center of Head. Sew buttons on Head for eyes. With 2 strands of C held together, embroider mouth with straight stitches from tip of Nose. Sew 3 whiskers on either side of Nose. For best results, lay tee-shirt flat and insert a piece of cardboard inside and smooth the shirt front. Referring to the photo, pin head in center of shirt. Carefully hand-stitch pieces using matching thread, being careful not to pull the thread too tightly in order to prevent puckering.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 494 Victory Red.
Tapestry needle; white pillowcase; sewing needle and matching thread OR fabric glue.
abbreviations: Shell = (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in next space.
Beg-Shell (Beginning Shell) = ch 3, (dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in same ch-space.
Picot = ch 3, slip st in side and top loops of last st.
3-dc-cluster = [yo and draw up a loop, yo and draw through 2 loops] 3 times all in same st, yo and draw through all 4 loops on hook.
measurements: Snowflake 1 (2, 3) measures 6 (6, 7)” in diameter.
gauge: 28 sts = 4” in dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Snowflake 1:
Ch 8; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 4, dc in ring, [dc, ch 1, dc] 13 times in ring; join with a slip st in 3rd ch of ch-4.
Round 2: [Slip st in next ch-1 space, ch 15, slip st in same space] 14 times – 14 loops. Fasten off.
Round 3: Attach thread in any ch-15 loop; * [ch 5, slip st in next ch-15 loop] 14 times.
Round 4: [Ch 5, (5 sc, ch 5, 5 sc) all in next ch-5 space] 14 times; join in first ch.
Round 5: Slip st in next ch of first ch-5 space, ch 1, [sc in ch-5 space, ch 3, shell in next ch-5 space, ch 3] 14 times; join in first sc.
Round 6: Slip st to ch-1 space of first shell, beg shell in ch-1 space, [ch 7, shell in next ch-1 space] 13 times, ch 7; join in top of ch-3.
Round 7: Slip st to ch-1 space of first shell, beg shell in ch-1 space, * ch 3, sc in next ch-7 space, ch 3 **, shell in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 8: Slip st to ch-1 space, ch 7, slip st in 3rd ch from hook, ([tr, picot] twice, tr) in first ch-1 space, * ch 3, sc in next sc, picot, ch 3 **, ([tr, picot] 3 times, tr) all in next ch-1-space; repeat from * around, end at **; join in 4th ch of ch-7. Fasten off.

Snowflake 2:
Ch 10; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3, 20 dc in ring; join with a slip st in top of ch-3 – 21 sts.
Round 2: Ch 6, [tr in next dc, ch 2] 20 times; join in 4th ch of ch-6.
Round 3: Ch 7, [tr in next tr, ch 3] 20 times; join in 4th ch of ch-7.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, [ch 7, sc in next tr] 20 times, ch 7; join in first sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [(4 sc, ch 3, 4 sc) in next ch-7 space] 21 times; join in first sc.
Round 6: Slip st to ch-3 space, ch 12, slip st in 9th ch from hook (ch-9 loop made), ch 10, slip st in 7th ch from hook, [ch 7, slip st in last slip st] twice, sc in last 3 ch of ch-10, ch 9, slip st in same slip st that closed first ch-9 loop, sc in last 3 ch of ch-12, ch 5, slip st in next ch-3 space of Round 5, * ch 7, slip st in last ch-9 space, ch 4, slip st in 4th ch of ch-7 (ch-9 loops joined), ch 10, slip st in 7th ch from hook, [ch 7, slip st in last slip st] twice, sc in last 3 ch of ch-10 **, ch 9, slip st in same slip st that closed previous joined ch-9 loop, sc in last 3 ch of ch-7, ch 5, slip st in next ch-3 space of Round 5; repeat from * around, end at **; ch 4, slip st in first ch-9 loop, ch 4, slip st in same slip st that closed previous ch-9 loop, sc in last 3 ch of ch-7, ch 5; join. Fasten off.

Snowflake 3:
Ch 10; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 24 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 4, tr in next sc, ch 7, [skip next 2 sc, tr in next 2 sc, ch 7] 5 times; join with a slip st in top of ch-4.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, sc in next tr, * (5 sc, ch 3, 5 sc) all in next ch-7 space **, sc in next 2 tr; repeat from * around, end at **; join in first sc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next sc, ch 11, [skip next 10 sc, dc in next 2 sc, ch 11] 5 times; join in top of ch-3.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, sc in next dc, * (7 sc, ch 3, 7 sc) all in next ch-11 space **, sc in next 2 dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in next sc, ch 15, [skip next 14 sc, dc in next 2 sc, ch 15] 5 times; join; TURN, slip st in last ch-15 made; TURN.
Round 7: [Ch 7, (9 sc, ch 7, 9 sc) all in next ch-15 space] 6 times.
Round 8: Slip st in next ch-7 space, ch 3, 4 dc in same ch-7 space, * ch 7, (3-dc-cluster, [ch 5, 3-dc-cluster] twice, ch 3, slip st) all in 4th ch from hook, sc in next 3 ch, 5 dc in same ch-7 space **, ch 5, 5 dc in next ch-7 space; repeat from * around, end at **; ch 3, dc in top of ch-3 to join and form last space.
Round 9: [Ch 9, slip st in next ch-5 space] 36 times working last slip st in joining dc.
Round 10: Ch 1, [(5 sc, ch 3, 5 sc) all in next ch-9 space] 3 times, * (5 sc, ch 1, slip st in last ch-3 space made, ch 1, 5 sc) in next ch-9 space, [(5 sc, ch 3, 5 sc) all in next ch-9 space] twice; repeat from * to last ch-9 space working sts in brackets once on last repeat; (5 sc, ch 1, slip st in first ch-3 space, ch 1, 5 sc) all in last ch-9 space; join in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Block snowflakes and apply as desired.

materials: Coordinated sewing thread and needle to sew on T-shirts as desired
measurements: Ladybug measures 2” across with ½” for head
gauge: Not needed for this project
instructions:
Ladybug
Body With A, chain 4.

Round 1: Work 7 double crochet in the 4th chain from hook (skipped chains count as first double crochet), change to B in last double crochet, with B, 2 double crochet in same chain, change to A in last double crochet – 10 double crochet. Join with a slip stitch in first skipped chain.
Round 2: With A, chain 2 (counts as half double crochet), half double crochet in same stitch as joining, 2 half double crochet in each of next 7 stitches, changing to B in last half double crochet, with B, 2 half double crochet in each of next 2 stitches, changing to A in last half double crochet – 20 half double crochets. Join with a slip stitch in 2nd chain of beginning chain-2.

Round 3: With A, chain 2, half double crochet in same chain as joining, half double crochet in next stitch, (2 half double crochet in next stitch, half double crochet in next stitch) 7 times, change to B in last half double crochet; with B, (2 double crochet in next double crochet, double crochet in next double crochet) twice, changing to A in last double crochet – 24 half double crochet and 6 double crochet. Join with a slip stitch in 2nd chain of beginning chain-2. Fasten off, leaving an 8” tail of B.

Black line on back
Working on back side of body with yarn needle, weave black end to center of body. Insert crochet hook from right side into center and pull up black loop. With black section at bottom, insert hook back into body in red section directly above black section about ¼” away and pull up another loop, pulling loop through loop on hook (surface chain made). Work about 3 more surface chains across in a straight line up to edge of body, splitting red section in half as shown in photo – 4 or 5 surface chains. Fasten off.

Head
With B, chain 3.
Round 1: Work 6 double crochet in 3rd chain from hook. Fasten off. Sew flat edge of head (beginning chs and last double crochet) to top of body above surface chains as shown in photo.

Antennae
With B, chain 8. Fasten off, leaving long ends. Weave antennae through top of head. Weave long tails back through antennae chain and sew into back of head to conceal.

Finishing
Weave in all ends. Sew 2 buttons on each side of line on red body section with sewing needle and thread. Pin ladybug to shirt as desired and stitch in place.

FLOWER
With either C or E (center of flower), chain 2.
Round 1: (right side) Work 10 single crochet in 2nd chain from hook – 10 single crochet. Join with slip stitch to first single crochet. Fasten off.
Round 2: With right side facing, join D with slip stitch in any single crochet, double crochet in same stitch as joining (double crochet, slip stitch) in next stitch; *(slip stitch, double crochet) in next stitch, (double crochet, slip stitch) in next stitch; repeat from * 3 times more – 5 petals made. Join with slip stitch to first slip stitch. Fasten off.

Finishing
Weave in ends. Pin flower(s) to shirt as desired and stitch in place.

materials: Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each of 422 Golden Yellow A, 12 Black B, and 494 Victory Red C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 2.75 mm [US C-2]
Susan Bates® Steelite Crochet Hook: 2.35 mm [1]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Sun measures 3" [7.5 cm] across widest point.
gauge: Approximately 7 sc = 1" [2.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SPECIAL STITCHES
sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
sc3tog = [draw up a loop in next st] 3 times, yarn over and draw through all 4 loops on hook.

SUN
Beginning at center, with A, ch 2. 
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook (do not join)—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of Round and move marker up as each Round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—24 sc. 
Round 5: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—30 sc. 
Round 6: *Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—36 sc. 
Round 7: *Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—42 sc.

RAY (make 7) 
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in next 6 sc; turn—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, sc2tog, sc in last 2 sc; turn—5 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc3tog, sc in last sc; turn—3 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc3tog; turn—1 st.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in top of st, do not turn but work 3 slip sts down side of Ray, sc in same sc on Sun as last sc of Row 1 was worked—Ray completed.
At end of 7th Ray, join with slip st in next sc of Round 7 of Sun. Fasten off and weave in ends.

SUNGLASSES (make 2) 
Using smaller steel hook and single strand of B, ch 4; work 11 dc in 3rd ch from hook (ch-3 counts as first dc); join with slip st in top of ch-3—12 dc. Fasten off, leaving end for sewing.

ASSEMBLY
Referring to photo for placement, sew Sunglasses in place. Using double strand of C, embroider with couched stitches to create smile.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Classic Crochet Thread™, Size 10 (Solids: 350 yds; Shaded colors: 300 yds)
Size U.S. 7 (1.65 mm) steel crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 3" [7.5 cm] between leaf points.
instructions:
Notes
• Each corsage can be made from 1 or more cabbage roses. 2 leaves are attached to each rose.
• Each rose is made from a long strip of crochet that is rolled into a spiral and secured into a rose shape.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.

Cabbage Rose
With A, leaving a long end, ch 29 loosely.
1st row: (RS). Working in back bumps of foundation ch, (1 tr. Ch 1. 1 tr) in 4th ch from hook. *Ch 1. (1 tr. Ch 1. 1 tr) in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 52 tr and 51 ch-1 sps.
2nd row: Ch 3. (1 tr. Ch 1. 1 tr) in first ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. (1 tr. Ch 1. 1 tr) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 102 tr and 101 ch-1 sps.
3rd row: Ch 1. *3 sc in next ch-1 sp. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. 3 tr in each of next 2 ch-1 sps. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 3 sc in last ch-1 sp. 303 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end.

Finishing
Thread yarn back and forth through ends of rows to first ch of foundation row. Coil work at foundation ch into Cabbage Rose. Secure coiled foundation ch with sewing needle and thread. Fasten securely.

LEAF (make 2)
With C, ch 22.
1st row: (WS). Working in back bumps of foundation ch, 1 dc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 20 dc. Do not break C.
2nd row: With B, ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 tr in each of first 12 sts. 1 dc in each of next 6 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in each of 2 skipped ch of 1st row. Do not turn. Working across opposite rem loops of foundation ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 6 ch. 1 tr in last 12 ch. Turn. 44 sts.
3rd row: Ch 3. Working through both loops, 1 tr in each of first 12 sts. 1 dc in each of next 6 sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 2 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dc in each of next 6 sts. 1 tr in each of last 12 sts. Turn. 46 sts. Fasten off B.
4th row: With C, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 22 sts. 2 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 22 sts. 1 sc in top of beg ch-3. Do not turn. Working in ends of rows along side edge, Ch 1. 1 sc around posts of tr at end of next 2 rows. 1 sc in end of foundation ch. 1 sc around post of dc at end of next row. 1 sc around post of tr at end of next 2 rows. 1 sc around post of st of next row. Fasten off.

Center Vein
Note: Center vein is worked in surface slip st using B.
Holding long end of B at back of leaf, insert hook in sp between first 2 dc of 1st row. Yoh and pull up a loop. *Skip next 2 dc (elongating loop of B so that it spans the 2 dc). Insert hook in next sp before next dc sts. Yoh and pull up a loop. Rep from * to last sp. Yoh and draw up a loop. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew leaves to back of rose. Use safety pin to pin one or more roses into place on a dress or glove to use as a corsage or use bobby pin to place in hair. Allow leaf tips to curl for more realistic look.

materials: Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 494 Victory Red A and 12 Black B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 2.75 mm [US C-2]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Lips measure 3½" wide x 1¾" high [9 cm x 4.5 cm].
gauge: Approximately 7 sc = 1" [2.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
LIPS
Beginning at bottom of Lip, with A, ch 8. 
Row 1 (Right Side): Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 5 chs, 2 sc in last ch; turn—9 sc.
Rows 2-5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—17 sc. 
Row 6: Ch 1, slip st in first sc, sc in next 15 sc; turn (1 sc left unworked)—16 sts. 
Row 7: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next sc, skip 1 sc, 5 dc in next sc, skip 2 sc, slip st in next sc, skip 2 sc, 5 dc in next sc, skip 1 sc, sc in next sc, sc2tog; do not turn—15 sts.
Edge
Ch 1, work 3 sc in corner of Mouth, sc evenly to opposite corner of Mouth, 3 sc in corner, sc in next 3 sts (the third sc should be worked in the first dc of Row 7), 2 sc in each of the next 3 dc, sc in next dc, slip st in slip st, sc in next dc, 2 sc in each of the next 3 dc, sc in next 3 sts; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Referring to photo for placement, with one strand of B, embroider with back stitches between Rows 5 and 6, going slightly upwards at sides to make a smile.

materials: RED HEART® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 2 balls 201 White A, 1 ball 12 Black B
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
sc2tog: [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Skeletton Applique measures 12" [30 cm] tall
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions: Holding 2 strands of A together, ch 9.  Row 1: Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 8 sts.  Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st – 10 sts. Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st – 12 sts. Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st – 14 sts. Row 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 8: Ch 1, turn, sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 10 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st – 16 sts. Row 9: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 10: Ch 1, turn, sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 12 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st – 18 sts. Row 11: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 12: Ch 1, turn, sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 14 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st – 20 sts. Rows 13-16: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 17: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 17 sts, sc2tog – 18 sts. Row 18: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 19: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 15 sts, sc2tog – 16 sts. Row 20: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 21: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 13 sts, sc2tog – 14 sts. Row 22: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 23: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 11 sts, sc2tog – 12 sts. Row 24: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 9 sts, sc2tog – 10 sts. Row 25: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 7 sts, sc2tog – 8 sts. Row 26: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 5 sts, sc2tog – 6 sts.  Do Not Fasten Off. Edging: Ch 1, sc evenly spaced around entire Head, slip st in first sc to join. Fasten off.  Body is worked along foundation ch to make spine, from top to bottom on first side and from bottom back to top along opposite side to form hips, ribs and shoulders. Holding 2 strands of A together, ch 27 for Spine. Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 5 ch to form neck, ch 12, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 11 ch for shoulder, slip st in next ch of foundation ch, slip st in next 4 ch, [ch 10, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 9 ch, slip st in next ch of foundation ch, slip st in next 2 ch] 3 times for 3 ribs, ch 7, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 6 ch for rib, slip st in next ch of foundation ch, slip st in next 4 ch, ch 12, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 11 ch for hip, slip st in next ch of foundation ch, turn work to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, ch 12, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 11 ch for second hip, slip st in same ch of foundation ch, slip st in next 4 ch, ch 7, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 6 ch for rib, slip st in next ch of foundation ch, [slip st in next 2 ch  ch 10, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 9 ch, slip st in next ch of foundation ch] 3 times for 3 ribs, slip st in next 4 ch, ch 12, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 11 ch for shoulder, slip st in next ch of foundation ch, slip st in remaining chs to first st. Fasten off.  ARMS (Make 2) Holding 2 strands of A together, ch 21. Row 1: Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 20 sts. Row 2: Ch 1, do not turn, sc 4 sts in  last ch. Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st – 4 sts. Row 4: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 3 sts – 3 sts. Row 5: Slip st in row end next to last st just made, ch 3, turn, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next ch to form first finger, [slip st in next st, ch 4, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next ch] 3 times to form 3 fingers, slip st in row end next to last st just made, ch 3, turn, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next ch, to form last finger.  Fasten off.  LEGS (Make 2) Holding 2 strands of A together, ch 21. Row 1: Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 20 sts. RIGHT FOOT Holding 2 strands of A together, ch 7. Row 1: Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 6 sts. Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st, turn to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, sc in next 4 sts – 10 sts. Round 3: Working in continuous rounds, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next 2 sts, sc in next 5 sts, slip st in  next st. Row 4: [Ch 3, slip st in same space and in next space] 4 times for 4 toes, ch 4, slip st in same place and in next st for big toe.  Fasten off.  LEFT FOOT Holding 2 strands of A together, ch 7. Row 1: Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 6 sts. Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 5 st, 2 sc in next st, turn to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, sc in next 4 sts – 10 sts. Round 3: Working in continuous rounds, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next 2 sts, sc in next 5 sts, slip st in  next st. Row 4: Ch 4, slip st in same place and in next st for big toe, [ch 3, slip st in same space and in next space] 4 times for 4 toes.  Fasten off.  FINISHING Following photo and using 1 strand of B, embroider mouth on Head with straight stitches. Sew on buttons for eyes. Embroider eye brows above eyes. For best results, lay tee-shirt flat and insert a piece of cardboard inside and smooth the shirt front. Referring to the photo, pin Skeleton pieces to upper middle portion of shirt. Arrange limbs as desired. Carefully hand-stitch pieces using matching thread, being careful not to pull the thread too tightly in order to prevent puckering.

materials: Size 3.75 mm (U.S. F or 5) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
measurements: Approx 3 ins [7.5 cm] wide.
gauge: 20 sc and 20 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]
instructions:
With MC, ch 3. Join with sl st to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook - Picot made. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 3 times more. Picot. Miss last sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *Working behind Picot, 1 sc in next missed sc of 2nd rnd. Ch 2. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 Petals. Fasten off.
4th rnd: Join A with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. 4 dc. 1 sc) in same sp. [(1 sc. 4 dc. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp] 4 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 Petals.
5th rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). *Working from back to front behind last rnd, 1 sc in next ch-2 sp of 3rd rnd between center 2 dc. Ch 3. Rep from * 4 times more. Miss first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to next sc. Fasten off.
6th rnd: Join MC with sl st to any ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. 6 dc. 1 sc) in same sp. [(1 sc. 6 dc. 1 sc) in next ch-3 sp] 4 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 Petals.
7th rnd: Ch 3 (does not count as st). *Working from back to front behind last rnd, 1 sc in next ch-3 sp of 5th rnd between center 2 dc. Ch 4. Rep from * 4 times more. Miss first ch 3. Join with sl st to next sc. Fasten off.
8th rnd: Join A with sl st to any ch-4 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. 1 dc. 4 tr. 1 dc. 1 sc) in same ch-4 sp. [(1 sc. 1 dc. 4 tr. 1 dc. 1 sc) in next ch-4 sp] 4 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 Petals.
9th rnd: Ch 3 (does not count as st). *Working from back to front behind last rnd, 1 sc in ch-4 sp of 7th rnd between center 2 tr. Ch 5. Rep from * 4 times more. Miss first ch 3. Join with sl st to next sc. Fasten off.
10th rnd: Join MC with sl st to any ch-5 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. 2 dc. 6 tr. 2 dc. 1 sc) in same sp. [(1 sc. 2 dc. 6 tr. 2 dc. 1 sc) in next ch-5 sp] 4 times. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 5 Petals.
Edging: Join B with sl st to any sc of 4th rnd. Work 1 sc in every st around edge of petals. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Rep for rem petals on rnds 6, 8, and 10.

measurements: Approx 3" x 4" [7.5 x 10 cm] for Sunflower motif.

instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.

ALL MOTIFS
Slip Knot

Version 2 Color 1 – F, Color 2 – L.

Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first sc. 8 sc.

materials: RED HEART® Baby Sheen™: 1 ball 700 Pink
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Applique measures 2” (5 cm) in diameter
gauge: Rounds 1-2 measure 2” (5 cm) in diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FLOWER APPLIQUE (Make 7)
Ch 4, join with slip st to form ring.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 1, [sc in ring, ch 7] 5 times; join with slip st in first sc — 5 sc and 5 ch-7 loops.
Round 2: Slip st in first ch-7 loop, ch 1, (4 sc, hdc, ch 1, hdc, 4 sc) in each ch-7 loop around; join with slip st in first sc — 5 petals. Fasten off; weave ends in.
FINISHING
Block Flower Appliques. Referring to photo for placement, pin Flower Appliques to T-shirt and sew in place using needle and thread, stitching slightly underneath the edges of the petals to hide the thread.

materials: RED HEART® With Love™: 1 skein each 1704 Bubble Gum A and 1601 Lettuce B.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Flower measures 3½” in diameter.
gauge: In sc: Flower = 3½” in diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FLOWER
With A, ch 5, join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, [sc in ring, ch 1] 6 times, join with a slip st in first sc – 6 sc; 6 ch-1 spaces.
Round 2: Beg popcorn in first st, ch 1, *popcorn in next st, ch 1; repeat from * around, join with a slip st in top of first beg popcorn – 6 popcorns; 6 ch-1 spaces.
Round 3: (Ch 3, cl, ch 3, slip st) in same space, (slip st, ch 5, slip st) in next ch-1 space, *(slip st, ch 3, cluster, ch 3, slip st) in top of next popcorn, (slip st, ch 5, slip st) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, join with a slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
LEAVES
With right side facing, join B with a slip st in any ch-5 space, *[ch 3, cluster, picot, ch 3, slip st] twice in same space, ch 1, (slip st, ch 3, cluster, picot, ch 3, slip st) in next ch-5 space, ch 1, slip st in next ch-5 space; repeat from * around, placing last slip st in same space as first leaf. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds /333 m)
Contrast A Aran (0313) - 1 ball or 50 yds/46 m
Contrast B Perfect Pink (0706) - 1 ball or 40 yds/36.5 m
Contrast C Cherry Red (0319) - 1 ball or 6 yds/5.5 m
Contrast D Medium Thyme (0406) - 1 ball or 6 yds/5.5 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: One size to fit Adult.
gauge: 12 half double crochet (hdc) and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Chain (ch) 52. 
1st row: Right Side (RS). 1 half double crochet (hdc) in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 2 hdc in next ch.*1 hdc in each of next 4 ch. 2 hdc in next ch. Repeat (rep) from * to end of chain. Turn. 60 hdc
2nd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 70 hdc.
3rd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 80 hdc.
4th row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Break A. Join B. Turn. 90 hdc.
5th row: With B, skip first 2 hdc. *5 double crochet (dc) in next hdc. Skip next hdc. Slip stitch (sl st) in each of next 2 hdc. Skip next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
With length of D, use back stitch to embroider cherry stems on Collar as shown in photo.
With length of C, use satin stitch to embroider cherries on Collar as shown in photo.
Cherry Drawstring: With D, ch 120. Fasten off. Leave ends for sewing. Using yarn needle, weave Drawstring in and out through sts of 1st row.
Cherries (make 2): With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker (PM). 6 sc. Do not join, cont working in spiral as follows. PM (first marker) for beg of rnd. Move marker up on rnds as work progresses. Note: Do not join at ends of rounds (rnds) unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd to 5th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
6th rnd: Sc2tog 6 times. 6 sc.
Fasten off leaving long end. Stuff cherry firmly. Sew Cherries to ends of Drawstring using ends left for sewing as shown in photo.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 805 Blue Hawaii A, 226 Natural B, and 480 Delft C
Yarn needle, sewing needle and matching threads
abbreviations: dc3tog = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 3 times, yarn over, draw through all 4 loops on hook.
picot = Ch 3, slip st in 3rd ch from hook.
V-st (V-stitch) = (Dc, ch 1, dc) in indicated space.

2-dc Cl (2 double crochet Cl) = Yarn over, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops on hook (2 loops remain on hook); yarn over, insert hook in same stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops, yarn over, draw through all 3 loops on hook.

3-dc Cl (3 double crochet Cl) = Yarn over, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops on hook (2 loops remain on hook); [yarn over, insert hook in same stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yarn over, draw through all 4 loops on hook.

2-sc Cl (2 single crochet Cl) = Insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, yarn over, insert hook in same stitch, yarn over, pull up loop, yarn over, draw through all 4 loops on hook.
measurements: Finished diameters after blocking: Doilies I and II: 2¼” (5.5 cm), Doilies III and IV: 2¾” (7 cm), Doily V: 4¾” (12 cm), Doily VI: 3¼” (8.5 cm), Doily VII: 3¾” (9.5 cm)
gauge: Rounds 1–4 of Motif 1 = 2¼” (5.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: Notes 1. Fourteen doilies in 7 motifs are worked in joined rounds with right side facing at all times. 2. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops on hook to complete stitch. Proceed with new color. Cut old color. 3. Refer to photographs for placement on purchased jacket or arrange and sew as desired. Special Stitches Beg dc3tog = Ch 3, [yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yarn over, draw through all 3 loops on hook. Beg V-st (beginning V-stitch) = Ch 4, dc in indicated space. Beg 2-dc Cl (beginning 2 double crochet Cl) = Ch 3, yarn over, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, [yarn over, draw through 2 loops on hook] 2 times. Beg 3-dc Cl (beginning 3 double crochet Cl) = Ch 3, yarn over, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops on hook, insert hook in same stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through all 3 loops on hook. Designed by Lisa Gentry What you will need: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 805 Blue Hawaii A, 226 Natural B, and 480 Delft C Susan Bates® Steelite® Crochet Hook: 1.7mm [US 5] Yarn needle, sewing needle and matching threads GAUGE: Rounds 1–4 of Motif 1 = 2¼” (5.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge. AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10, Art. 154 available in white & ecru 400 yd; solid color 350 yd; shaded color 300 yd balls Continued... Motif 1 (make 1 each with A and C) Ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1: Beg 3-dc Cl in ring, *ch 3, 3-dc Cl in ring; repeat from * 4 times, ch 3; join with slip st in beg 3-dc Cl—six 3-dc Cls and 6 ch-3 spaces. Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first 3-dc Cl, ch 5, sc in next ch-3 space, *ch 5, sc in next 3-dc Cl, ch 5, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, ch 2, dc in first sc (ch 2, dc counts as last ch-5 space)—12 sc and 12 ch-5 spaces. Round 3: Ch 1, sc in last ch-5 space, (ch 6, sc) in each remaining ch-5 space, ch 3, dc in first sc (ch 3, dc counts as last ch-6 space—12 sc and 12 ch-6 spaces. Round 4: Ch 1, sc in last ch-6 space (ch 7, sc) in each remaining ch-6 space, ch 7; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc and 12 ch-7 spaces. Fasten off. Motif 2 (make 2) With A, ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1: Work same as Round 1 of Motif 1; change to B. Rounds 2–4: Work same as Rounds 2–4 of Motif 1. Motif 3 (make 2) With B, ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in ring, *ch 2, 2 dc in ring; repeat from * 4 times, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beg ch—12 dc and 6 ch-2 spaces. Round 2: Slip st in next dc and first ch-2 space, ch 5 (counts as first dc and ch 2), dc in same ch-2 space, [ch 2, dc] 2 times in each remaining ch-2 space, ch 2; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beg ch—12 dc and 12 ch-2 spaces. Round 3: (Beg 2-dc Cl, ch 3, 2-dc Cl) in first dch, (ch 3, dc) in next dc, *[ch 3, 2-dc Cl] 2 times in next dc, (ch 3, dc) in next dc; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in beg 2-dc Cl—twelve 2-dc Cls, 6 dc, and 18 ch-3 spaces. Round 4: Slip st in next dc and first ch-3 space, (beg 3-dc Cl, picot, 3-dc Cl) in same ch-3 space, ch 3, (3-dc Cl, picot, 3-dc Cl) in next dc, *ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, (3-dc Cl, picot, 3-dc Cl) in next ch-3 space, ch 3, (3-dc Cl, picot, 3-dc Cl) in next dc; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in beg 3-dc Cl—twenty-four 3-dc Cls, 12 picots, and 12 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off. Motif 4 (make 2) With B, ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1: Work same as Round 1 of Motif 3. Round 2: Work same as Round 2 of Motif 3; change to A. Round 3: Work same as Round 3 of Motif 3; change to C. Round 4: Work same as Round 4 of Motif 3. Motif 5 (make 2) With A, ch 7; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 23 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beg ch—24 dc. Round 2: Ch 3, dc in first dc, *ch 3, skip next dc, 2 dc next dc; repeat from * around, ch 3, skip last dc; join with slip st in top of beg ch— 24 dc and 12 ch-3 spaces. Round 3: Slip st in next dc and first ch-3 space, ch 3, 4 dc in same ch-3 space, (ch 1, 5 dc) in each remaining ch-3 space, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beg ch—60 dc and 12 ch-1 spaces. Round 4: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in last ch-1 space, (ch 6, sc) in each remaining ch-1 space, ch 6; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc and 12 ch-6 spaces. Fasten off. Round 5: Join B with slip st in any ch-6 space, (beg 3-dc Cl, ch 3, 3-dc Cl) in same ch-6 space, [ch 3, 3-dc Cl] 2 times in each remaining ch-6 space, ch 3; join with slip st in beg 3-dc Cl— 24 3-dc Cls and 24 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off. Continued... Round 6: Join C with slip st in any ch-3 space, ch 1, sc in same ch-3 space, (ch 5, sc) in each remaining ch-3 space, ch 5; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc and 24 ch-5 spaces. Round 7: (Slip st, ch 3, 3 dc, 2 tr, picot, 2 tr, 4 dc) in first ch-5 space (first shell made), sc in next ch-5 space, [(ch 5, sc) in next ch-5 space] 2 times, *(4 dc, 2 tr, picot, 2 tr, 4 dc) in next ch-5 space (shell made), sc in next ch-5 space, [(ch 5, sc) in next ch-5 space] 2 times; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beg ch—6 shells, 18 sc, and 12 ch-5 spaces. Fasten off. Motif 6 (make 1 each with A and C) Ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1: Ch 6 (counts as first dc and ch-3 space), dc in ring, [ch 3, dc in ring] 6 times, ch 3; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beg ch—8 dc and 8 ch-3 spaces. Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, (ch 6, sc) in each dc, ch 6; join with slip st in first sc—8 dc and 8 ch-6 spaces. Round 3: Slip st in first ch-6 space, ch 3 (counts as first dc), (2 dc, ch 5, 3 dc) in same ch-6 space, (3 dc, ch 5, 3 dc) in each remaining ch-6 space; join with slip st in top of beg ch-3—48 dc and 8 ch-5 spaces. Round 4: Beg dc3tog, ch 5, 3 dc in first ch-5 space, ch 5, dc3tog, *dc3tog, ch 5, 3 dc in next ch-5 space, ch 5, dc3tog; repeat from * around; join with slip st in beg dc3tog—40 dc and 16 ch-5 spaces. Round 5: (Slip st, ch 1, sc, picot, sc) in first ch-5 space, ch 3, dc3tog, ch 3, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-5 sp, *ch 3, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-5 space, ch 3, dc3tog, ch 3, (sc, picot, sc, ch 3) in next ch-5 space; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc—8 dc, 32 sc, and 24 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off. Motif 7 (make 2) With C, ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1: Ch 1, sc in ring, *ch 4, sc in ring; repeat from * 4 times, ch 1, dc in first sc (ch 1, dc count as last ch-4 sp)—6 sc and 6 ch-4 spaces. Round 2: Beg V-st in last ch-4 space, (ch 4, V-st) in each remaining ch-4 space, ch 4; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beg V-st—6 V-sts and 6 ch-4 spaces. Round 3: Slip st in ch-1 space of first V-st, ch 3 (counts as first dc), 4 dc in same space, (ch 3, 5 dc) in ch-1 space of each remaining V-st, ch 3; change to A; join with slip st in top of beg ch—30 dc and 6 ch-3 spaces. Round 4: Ch 1, 2-sc Cl in same st as join, (ch 1, sc) in next 3 dc, ch 1, 2-sc Cl in next dc, *ch 3, 2-sc Cl in next dc, (ch 1, sc) in next 3 dc, ch 1, 2-sc Cl in next dc; repeat from * around, ch 3; change to B; join with slip st in first 2-sc Cl—twelve 2-sc Cls, 18 sc, 6 ch-3 spaces, and 24 ch-1 spaces. Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first ch-1 space, (ch 3, sc) in next 3 ch-1 spaces, *ch 4, sc in next ch-1 space, (ch 3, sc) in next 3 ch-1 spaces; repeat from * around, ch 4; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc, 18 ch-3 spaces, and 6 ch-4 spaces. Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first ch-3 space, (ch 3, sc) in next 2 ch-3 spaces, *ch 8, sc in next ch-3 space, (ch 3, sc) in next 2 ch-3 spaces; repeat from * around, ch 8; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc, 12 ch-3 spaces, and 6 ch-8 spaces. Round 7: Ch 1, sc in first ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, (3 dc, [picot, 3 dc] 2 times) in same ch-8 space, *(ch 3, sc) in next 2 ch-3 spaces, ch 3, (3 dc, [picot, 3 dc] 2 times) in next ch-8 space; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc, 54 dc, and 18 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off. FINISHING Weave in ends. Block to finished diameters if desired. Refer to photographs as a guide for placement. With sewing needle and matching thread, sew doilies on front and back of jacket. ABBREVIATIONS A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C; ch = chain(s); dc = double crochet; hdc = half double crochet; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st; [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified; * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.

materials: Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 422 Golden Yellow A, 494 Victory Red B, 001 White C, 856 Peacock D, and 401 Orchid Pink E
Note: Only small quantities of each color are needed for this project.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 2.75 mm [US C-2]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Heart measures 1½" [4 cm] across widest part.
gauge: Approximately 7 sc = 1" [2.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEART (make 1 with each color)
Beginning at center, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; (do not join)—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of Round and move marker up as each Round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: Slip st in first sc, 3 dc in next sc, hdc in next 2 sc, sc in next 2 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc, hdc in next 2 sc, 3 dc in last sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Slip st in slip st, 2 sc in each of next 3 dc, sc in next 5 sts, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in each of next 3 dc; join with slip st in first slip st—27 sts. Fasten off and weave in ends.

materials: Large Flower 60104 (Azure) or 60437 (Rose) or 60012 (Taupe) 1 ball makes approx 15.
Small Flower 60130 (Sky) or 60416 (Blush) or 61008 (Natural) 1 ball makes approx 23.
Size 3.75 mm (U.S. F or 5) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
measurements: Approximately 15 inches for large flower and 23 inches for small flower.
gauge: 24 sc and 26 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
LARGE FLOWER (make 2)
Ch 8. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in ring. (Ch 6. 3 dc in ring) 5 times. Ch 6. 1 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next dc and next ch-6 loop. *Ch 1. (1 sc. 1 hdc. 7 dc. 1 hdc. 1 sc) in ch-6 loop. Ch 1. Miss next dc. Sl st in next dc. Rep from * 5 times more. Fasten off.
SMALL FLOWER (make 3)
Ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in ring. (Ch 4. 3 sc in ring) 5 times. Ch 4. 1 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next sc and next ch-4 loop. *(1 sc. 1 hdc. 4 dc. 1 hdc. 1 sc) in ch-4 loop. Miss next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * 5 times more. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Flowers to skirt as shown in picture.

pattern_name: Aunt Lydia’s Yummy Happy Face Emoji Appliqué
materials: Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 422 Golden Yellow A, 12 Black B, and 494 Victory Red C.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 2.75 mm [US C-2]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Emoji measures 2¾" [7 cm] diameter.
gauge: Approximately 7 sc = 1" [2.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: Beginning at center, with A, ch 2. Round 1 (Right Side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st to first sc—6 sc. Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in same sc as joining and each sc around; join—12 sc. Round 3: Ch 3 (counts as first dc now and throughout), dc in same sc as joining and each sc around; join with slip st in top of ch-3—24 sc. Round 4: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of ch-3—36 dc. Round 5: Ch 1, sc in same dc as joining and next 4 dc, 2 sc in next dc, *sc in next 5 dc, 2 sc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc. Round 6: Ch 1, sc in same sc as joining and next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, *sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc. Fasten off and weave in ends. Eye (make 2): With B, ch 2; work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving end for sewing. Tongue: With C, ch 3; sc in 2nd ch from hook, 3 sc in next ch; working on opposite side of ch, work 1 sc. Fasten off, leaving end for sewing. Assembly: Referring to photo for placement, with one strand of B, embroider with back stitches to create smile. Sew Eyes and Tongue in place.

materials: AUNT LYDIA'S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: small amounts of 423 Maize A, 493 French Rose B, 494 Victory Red C, 856 Peacock D, and 1 White E
Hot glue gun or heavy duty fabric glue
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Large Flower (make 3: 2 with A & B and 1 with A & C)
Center
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc. Fasten off.
Petals
With right side of center facing, join 2nd color with slip st in any sc, *ch 1, 2 dc in next sc, ch 1, slip st next sc (petal made); repeat from * around to last sc, ch 1, 2 dc in next sc, ch 1; join with slip st in first slip st—6 petals. Fasten off.
French Rose Flower (make 3)
With B, ch 7; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: [Ch 1, (3 hdc, slip st) in ring] 4 times; join with slip st in beginning ch. Fasten off.
Peacock Flower (make 2)
With D, ch 4, (slip st, [ch 3, slip st] 4 times) in back bar of 4th ch from hook; join with slip st in first slip st—5 petals. Fasten off. Pull gently on beginning tail to close.
Small Red Flower
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. Fasten off.
Round 2: With right side facing, sc join C in any sc, (ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc and 6 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Peacock Flower: With E, embroider straight stitches from center of flower to center of each petal. With C, embroider a French knot in center of each flower. Referring to photograph, glue flowers as shown on side side of sneaker or where desired.

materials: RED HEART® Super Tweed™: 1 skein each 7901 Fire A or 7708 Pinkberry B, and 7625 Camo C.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Flower measures 3½” in diameter
gauge: In sc: Flower = 3½” in diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FLOWER
With A or B, ch 5, join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, [sc in ring, ch 1] 6 times, join with a slip st in first sc – 6 sc; 6 ch-1 spaces. 
Round 2: Beg popcorn in first st, ch 1, *popcorn in next st, ch 1; repeat from * around, join with a slip st in top of first beg popcorn – 6 popcorns; 6 ch-1 spaces.
Round 3: (Ch 3, cl, ch 3, slip st) in same space, (slip st, ch 5, slip st) in next ch-1 space, *(slip st, ch 3, cluster, ch 3, slip st) in top of next popcorn, (slip st, ch 5, slip st) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, join with a slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
Leaves
With right side facing, join C with a slip st in any ch-5 space, *[ch 3, cluster, picot, ch 3, slip st] twice in same space, ch 1, (slip st, ch 3, cluster, picot, ch 3, slip st) in next ch-5 space, ch 1, slip st in next ch-5 space; repeat from * around, placing last slip st in same space as first leaf. Fasten off.
Crochet a clever flower and use it most anywhere–on a lapel, on a hat, in your hair, to wrap a gift, glued to pushpins on a bulletin board or glued to a magnet for holding messages on the refrigerator. The possibilities are many!
